# Standart lm diagnotic plots

Say we have some 80 data points that we with to model using $y \sim X1 + X2 + X3$. Here are the resulting diagnostic plots:

```{r, results='asis', fig.height=5, fig.width=5, warning=F, message=F, echo=F}
n = 80
x <- data.frame(rmvnorm(n, c(0, 0, 1), .5 * (diag(3) + matrix(.3, 3, 3))))
y <- x$X1 + 2*x$X2 + x$X3^2 + rnorm(n,0,.2)
l <- lm(y ~ X1 + X2 + X3, data=x)
plot(l)
```

# Can we do better?

```{r, results='asis', fig.height=5, fig.width=5, warning=F, message=F, echo=F}
gginc(1:2,by1var.seq(l, adjustedData=stages(NULL,F), connection=stages(NULL,F), rawData=stages(list(),F), line=stages(NULL,F), loess=stages(NULL,F),rug=stages(list(alpha=0),F)))

```
